thread.title: Let it fly: Amazing timelapse video shows creation of a FROZEN-themed Boeing 737 aircraft decorated with 600 litres of paint
thread.title_full: Let it fly: Amazing timelapse video shows the creation of a FROZEN-themed Boeing 737 aircraft decorated with 600 litres of paint | Daily Mail Online

author: Georgia Diebelius For Mailonline
title: Let it fly: Amazing timelapse video shows creation of a FROZEN-themed Boeing 737 aircraft decorated with 600 litres of paint
text:
View
comments
Your next flight may be a little colder than usual if you're lucky enough to get a seat on WestJet's new aircraft.
Becoming the second Disney plane in the Canadian airline's fleet, the Anna, Elsa and Olaf inspired jet was revealed following 265 hours of designing and 600 litres of paint.
Painters from Canada, the United States and Germany were hired for the around-the-clock project - which shows Olaf the snowman lounging on a beach near the front of the plane while the sisters work their icy winter magic from the tail.

The aircraft - which took 600 litres of paint to complete - will fly the Boeing 737's route, not just to Orlando
The Boeing 737 was transformed into a Disney-themed masterpiece following the 21-day project
The plane's original white, royal blue and aqua colouring was covered in white paint ready to be re-designed
The inside of the plane, which was painted in Fort Worth, Texas, has a changing season theme with blue and yellow lighting, overhead bins and headrests covered in sunflowers and snowflakes.

Man hospitalised for three days with severe gastroenteritis... Share this article Share Despite the Frozen-themed plane being inspired by Walt Disney World - it will operate flights throughout the 737 network, not just to Orlando.
The aircraft is equipped with WestJet Connect's new in-flight entertainment and connectivity system which will allow passengers to choose from a selection of on-demand Disney videos.
The jet was painted sky blue and navy before being branded with the Walt Disney World and WestJet logos
250 hours and 21-days was spent on the creation of the Anna, Elsa and Olaf themed plane in Texas
Smaller details - such as snowflakes, glitter and the sandcastle and ocean - were created by an airbrush artist
The inside of the plane, which was painted in Fort Worth, Texas, has a changing season theme with blue and yellow lighting, overhead bins and headrests covered in sunflowers and snowflakes
A video of the painting of the C-GWSV registered aircraft emerged this week and shows the step-by-step 21-day project in one and a half minutes.
The airline made the themed plane after the success of its first custom aircraft called Magic, which featured Mickey Mouse as the Sorcerer's Apprentice.
A spokesman for WestJet said: 'It's about creating joy and fun and making magical memories as well.'
